message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about neural abstractive summarization systems, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses attention-based and copy-based mechanisms, which are common techniques used in deep learning models for NLP tasks such as text generation and summarization. Therefore, cs.AI (artificial intelligence) and cs.LG (machine learning) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also evaluates the performance of the proposed method using ROUGE scores, which is a common evaluation metric in information retrieval (IR) and text summarization tasks, making cs.IR a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method for controlling the amount of copying in the generated summaries, which is a problem related to sequence-to-sequence learning and optimization, making cs.NE (neural and evolutionary computing) a possible sub-category as well.
